articles.title: Introduction to Anatomy
articles.description: Review the basic concepts of anatomy such as the anatomical position and anatomical planes. Also, learn important terminology that is essential before beginning you anatomy studies.

articles.title: Abdominal Aorta
articles.description: The abdominal aorta is the continuation of the thoracic aorta and is the main blood supply of the abdomen. It enters the abdominal cavity by passing through the aortic hiatus at T12 and terminates at L4 at the bifurcation of the common iliacs.

articles.title: Anterior Cruciate Ligament
articles.description: The anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) is one of the two cruciate ligaments in the knee. It is composed of two bundles, receives its blood supply from the middle genicular artery, and is innervated by the tibial nerve.

articles.title: Liver Segmental Anatomy
articles.description: The Couinaud Classification system is widely used to divide the liver into functional segments. Understanding these segments is useful for radiologists and surgeons.

articles.title: Uterus
articles.description: The uterus is positioned between the bladder and the rectum in the pelvis and is a central anatomical landmark of the female reproductive system.
